title: Brit Awards viewers claim 1975 were 'hacked' during their performance - but here's what really happened
text:
Get daily   Could   
Brit Awards viewers were left baffled during 1975's performance at the ceremony. 
While the band took to the stage, messages appeared on the screens behind them that left those watching at home questioning if the show had been "hacked". 
Messages including insults such as "out of tune" and "bland monotone beats" were displayed on screens behind the band as they belted out one of their hits. 
Some viewers rushed to social media to question why producers had let the "mishap" happen. Viewers were confused (Photo: ITV) Fans thought the show had been hacked (Photo: ITV) 
A confused tweeter wrote: "Did someone just hack the ITV and slag The 1975 off for their whole performance? Surely not part of the plan?" 
However, fans of the British band rushed to social media to reveal that the performance was basically ripped straight from the group's music video. There were rude messages behind the band (Photo: ITV) 
"PLEASE WATCH THE VIDEO FOR 'THE SOUND' BY THE 1975. IT WAS PART OF THE PERFORMANCE. STOP BEING BASIC," wrote one angry fan. 
Another added: "It is literally from their music video, as if people think they have been hacked smh I cannot" But it turns out it was just from their video (Photo: PA) 
The messages displayed behind the band were actually criticisms the band received following the release of their debut album. 
They included the insults as a sort of middle finger to the critics, now they've become one of the biggest bands in country. 
Despite their detractors, it turned out to be great night for the this year, as they managed to beat out Little Mix to Best British Group.
